item.value: This dialog allows you to set connection between the device and computer. If there are more devices on the line and you have already defined it, choose the connection from the "Choose existing device" combo box.

lblHint.caption: To access the following section of Wix is necessary to set the password.

lblSeparatedRecord.caption: Save data record to new line:

lblRewrite.caption: Rewrite file by the latest measured value:

item.value: This dialog allows you to set storing of the measured-out values to file. Dynamic text (measured-out values, date, time etc.) can be entered by special functions in vinculum. (For example: {TAB}, {Datetime(dd.mm.yyyy)}, {My_Device.My_Input.Value}). If there is an error in the function, it is in red font. Otherwise it is written in blue. Double click on the function in the "Functions list" will add it to the "Definition".

lblHint.caption: This dialog allows yout to set colors of panel background. Range can be divided by setting "threshold values". Each interval has two colors, that will be blinking..

chbSettingsPasswordEnabled.caption: Require a password to the Wix settings

chbDemoDialog.caption: Inform the exceeding of limits in the free version

Label22.caption:
This program runs as a fully functional DEMO version. Usage is not limited by time. The only restriction is in the number of devices and inputs.
Maximum number of devices: 5 Maximum number of inputs: 10
Any device or input above these limits will be disabled!

Label24.caption:
This program runs as a FULL version.
Maximum number of devices: unlimited Maximum number of inputs: unlimited

Label6.caption: Rewrite file by the latest measured value:

Label4.caption: Save data record to new line:

lblHint.caption: This dialog allows you to set storing of the measured-out values to file. Dynamic text (measured-out values, date, time etc.) can be entered by special functions in vinculum. (For example: {TAB}, {Datetime(dd.mm.yyyy)}, {My_Device.My_Input.Value}). If there is an error in the function, it is in red font. Otherwise it is written in blue. Double click on the function in the "Functions list" will add it to the "Definition".
This wizard helps you to set the storing format of measured-out values. Check inputs you want to store in files.

chkSaveTODatabase.caption: Store value to the archive, with period:

item.value: This dialog allows you to set inputs on the device. If the measured quantities are not in desired units, you can set a conversion formula as a line formula (y=kx+q). Alternative text can be displayed instead of numeric value (freezing, chilly, cool, warm and hot).

lblHint.caption: This dialog allows you to set the values ranges, colors, and graph view. Check the inputs you want to have displayed as graph.

item.value: This dialog allows you to set devices. Ethernet devices like TH2E, Quido or AD4ETH have to be set in "TCP Server" mode.

lblLanSSLWarning.caption: SSL encryption protocol is not supported. Authentication to some SMTP servers may not work. To support SSL is needed to install Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable Package.

item.value: This dialog allows you to set dynamic text (measured-out values, date, time etc). Dynamic text can be entered by special functions in vinculum. (For example: {TAB}, {Datetime(dd.mm.yyyy)}, {My_Device.My_Input.Value}). If there is an error in the function, it is in red font. Otherwise it is written in blue. Double click on the function in the "Functions list" will add it to the "Definition".

lblHint.caption: This dialog allows you to set alternative texts for the numeric values. Range can be divided by setting "threshold values". Each interval has its alternative text.
This dialog allows you to set colors of the bar graph displayed instead of measured-out values. Range can be divided by setting "threshold values". Each interval has its color.

Label2.caption:
This program runs as a fully functional DEMO version. Usage is not limited by time. The only restriction is in the number of devices and inputs.
Maximum number of devices: 5 Maximum number of inputs: 10
Any device or input above these limits will be disabled!

lRangeCheckHint.caption: In the event that the measured value oscillates around the chosen limits, the value of the resulting conditions change frequently. This phenomenon can be avoided by using hysteresis. The condition becomes false only in case if the value measured away from the limits more than the hysteresis.

lblAlwaysTrueHint.caption: The condition "Always true" should be used in conjunction with the periodic running actions. This combination can get a timer.

item.value: This dialog allows you set condition.

This dialog allows you to set action. You can put dynamic text (measured values, date, time etc.) to some fields (e-mail message, SMS message etc.) Easy settings for the dynamic text are accessible by clicking "Edit the text" button.

lSMSTextHint.caption: Number of characters can increase when dynamic text is used!

lSMSHint.caption: To use this event must be purchased and attached TC35 GSM modem.

lExportCmdBathName.caption: Path and name of the file:

lblPlayWavFileName.caption: Path and name of the file:

lblHint.caption: This dialog allows you to set actions following certain events. Action can by executed one time when the condition is satisfying or periodically over the validity of condition.

item.value: One time when the condition is satisfied
Periodically over the validity of condition

msgboxtext1-odstraneni.text: Are you sure you want to remove panel

msgboxtext-pridani1.text: Name of the sensor isn't entered!

msgboxtext-pridani2.text: Name of the sensor must be unique!

msgboxtext-pridani3.text: Name of the sensor must contain only letters, numbers and chars: -, _ !

msgboxtext-pridani4.text: Names of inputs and name of the sensor must be unique!

msgboxtext-pridani5.text: Names of inputs and name of the sensor must contain only letters, numbers and chars: -, _ !

msgboxtext-varovanigrafu.text: Units of selected sensors do not match!

msgboxtext2-varovanigrafu.text: Units of selected sensors are not consistent with the graph units!

msgfActions-SendEmail-Bad.text: Following error occured in sending the mail:

msgfActions-ExportWeb-Ok.text: Data were successfully uploaded to web.

uWxUnitsConfiguration_MsgBox1_Text.text: Name of unit must be non-empty!

DeviceDialogSpinelAddresMessage1.text: Device address can be set by the three ways:

SettingsWebServerMessage1.text: Measured values can be get at page: http://Server:Port/Data.xml

SpecialColorMessage1.text: You can use the special panel color when using graphs. If the graph shows several inputs, it is convinient to use the same color for inputs in the graph as well.

msgLicenseVersionMin.texy: License file is not compatible with version of the Wix!
